edge: Aragorn is the heir-in-exile to Gondor's throne.
Frodo Baggins has been sent on a quest to destroy the One Ring, which has become increasingly burdensome for him.
Sméagol, originally known as Gollum, is a hobbit-like monster who once owned the Ring for 500 years and now guides Frodo on his quest.
Meriadoc Brandybuck and Peregrin Took are distant cousins of Frodo's who travel with the Fellowship on their journey to Mordor.
Gandalf the White is an Istari wizard who fell fighting a Balrog and has now returned more powerful than ever to finish his task.
Frodo Baggins is accompanied on his quest by his loyal hobbit gardener, Samwise Gamgee, better known as Sam.
Meriadoc Brandybuck and Peregrin Took are mistakenly captured by the Uruk-hai.
Viggo Mortensen's character, Aragorn, comes to Rohan's defence.
A dwarf warrior and one of Aragorn's companions.
The King of Rohan, who is under Saruman's spell until Gandalf heals him so he can lead his people once more.
The Elven-Lord of Rivendell who expresses doubt over his daughter's love for Aragorn.
Théoden's niece, who is in love with Aragorn. Uma Thurman was offered the role but turned it down and later regretted it.
A prince of the Stewards of Gondor and captain of the Ithilien Rangers, who captures Frodo, Sam and Gollum.
An agent of Saruman at Edoras, who renders Théoden incapable of decisions, and desires Éowyn.
Théoden's nephew and previous Chief Marshal of the Riddermark who was exiled by Gríma.
An elven princess of Rivendell and Aragorn's true love.
An elven archer and one of Aragorn's companions.
An Istari wizard waging war upon Rohan and devastating Fangorn Forest, who allied himself with Sauron in the previous film.
The Elven-Queen of Lothlórien, who discusses Middle-earth's future with Elrond.
Cate Blanchett portrays Galadriel, the Elven-Queen of Lothlórien who discusses Middle-earth's future with Elrond.
Sean Bean plays Boromir, Faramir's older brother and a fallen member of the Fellowship who appears in flashbacks since his death.
Craig Parker portrays Haldir, the leader of the Lórien Elves sent by Elrond and Galadriel to defend Helm's Deep.
John Leigh depicts Háma, the loyal doorwarden of the Golden Hall and a majordomo of Théoden.
Bruce Hopkins portrays Gamling, Théoden's chief lieutenant and a skilled member of the Royal Guard of Rohan.
John Bach acts as Madril, Faramir's closest aide who informs him of battle preparations.
In the extended edition, Nathaniel Lees plays Ugluk, the leader of the band of Uruk-hai who kidnapped Merry and Pippin.

In the Battle of Helm's Deep, Peter Jackson makes a cameo appearance as one of the men on top of the gate, throwing a spear at the attacking Uruk-hai. John Noble portrays Denethor, the Steward of Gondor and the father of Boromir and Faramir.
In the Battle of Helm's Deep, Peter Jackson appears as one of the men on top of the gate, throwing a spear at the attacking Uruk-hai.
In the extended edition, Faramir's sister and Elijah Wood's sister cameo as young refugees in the caves behind the Hornburg.
In the extended edition, Alan Lee and Dan Hennah cameo as soldiers preparing for the battle.
In the Battle of Helm's Deep, Hamish Duncan appears as a reluctant young Rohirrim warrior.
In the Battle of Helm's Deep, Daniel Falconer has a cameo as an Elvish archer.
